reviews.review_msg: lecture is easy to understand but the quizzes are hard and exams are harder, but he is very nice and helpful if you have questions and struggles with the course. Don't try to email him, he won't reply. you have to go to his office.
helpful and nice, willing to help, though some time late for the class. He is good anyway.

Not a very good teacher. He doesn't explain much, especially since there are no pre reqs for the class. Felt like he need ed to go slower and explain at a more bas ic level than what he was teaching at. Assumes you understand what's going on. Better to read the book or talk to somebody in class that understands the material.

He's very clear, helpful and easy to talk to but he's one of the hardest profs you'll meet. If you don't have interest for the course, you might as well drop it. Only recommended for people that are good at studying on their own. Odd scaling method, instead of scaling from average, he scales from the highest mark. Which may or may not be helpful.

People need to take the general pattern of ratings here seriously. He is one of those teachers that has a penchant for making a course much harder than it needs to be. The textbook is bad and his notes are even worse. Does not make clear which material are relevant to the course so you always waste time studying extra stuff.
No tutorials to practice on the stuff he teaches. Last coding assignment super difficult. Messy/useless notes. Best to rely on textbook instead of his lectures.

His lectures seem to be unrelated to the assignments and exams.  Assignments are very very very hard, the hardest that I have ever had in a course I've taken so far.  Midterm wwere also pretty difficult, class average was in the mid 30%.
don't take course with him...
No Comment.
He really knows how to explain his stuff. If you ask a question in class, he will answer it and make sure you understand it.
Just enjoy his lectures.
Nice clear prof! I really wished he'd upload his notes though.
He teaches well but misleads you concerning midterms so aspect to be surprised on midterms. HE does not make his tests based on the textbook HW, so doing text book HW is a big waist of time.

Bobby is a great professor, any help you need, he will give it. He's mostly pretty clear in lecture. The course I found to be very difficult, thankfully it's the last one of its kind I have to take to get a CMPT minor. You absolutely need to attend lecture because the textbook is useless.

Bobby is a very nice guy. His friendly demeanor makes him very approachable inside and outside of lecture. He is very organized with good notes that you print out and follow along with in lecture. His midterms are pretty easy. Overall, a very good professor. Be warned, CMPT 150 itself is not a fun course, but Bobby makes it bearable.
The best prof in sfu!
He is cute. Lecture clearly.
Great Prof

It has been a privilege taking Bobby's CMPT course. He is super helpful and encouraging, so no one hesitates to ask questions in his class! Also, I like his smile which makes him more friendly-looking and approachable. The textbook was nearly useless. I used it only for practice questions. He is definitely one of the best profs you can take in SFU.
Great prof, responds to feedback, actually cares about students. Material for this course is boring and dry though.
BEST PROF HANDS DOWN! Clear, understandable and helpful. Would definitely recommend taking courses with this prof.

Recommended to print notes for lectures. Had a hard time following what was going on because I prefer writing notes from scratch, but once I started printing them, lectures became less painful. He goes very fast & it's difficult to decipher his notes afterwards. He's got excellent verbal explanations though. Doesn't give much practice material
best cmpt prof i met so far.in last day lecture, everyone stand up and applaud for him.strongly recommand to take everything with him.
He is a awesome prof
He's amazing, he smiles all the time, he's extremely helpful and he's lectures are actually helpful
GREAT Proff..
HE IS THE BEST
An excellent teacher!! Notes are very helpful. Assignments are fair but he'll provide lots of help. Study his notes and you'll do fine on the exams. Yup.. he's hot too =)

If he could teach all my cmpt courses, I wouldn't hav to use ratemyprofs.com ever again!! Dont be fooled by his age, although he's a student himself I think?, he was an excellent prof who explained the topics and information well.  He used slides to teach 150 and gave relevant exmples in lecture.  His midterms were fair and based on exactly whatwas
No Comments
She is really caring to her students .

decent teacher. she is helpful. But this is a difficult course. Don't skip class or it will be extremely hard to catch up because she didn't provide much info on her lecture notes. you gotta read not only one but other books about computer design and that help you understand her lecture. if you can't, drop it or cmpt250 will let you down
Avoid her she likes making the course more difficult then it actually is. Avoid her at no cost!!!
Wish he offered more courses!!
Best prof in SFU till now. 150 250
Teaches information very clearly. Once you understand his teaching style and the basics, the class is very easy. Textbook was totally unnecessary. Great prof

By far my most enjoyable class of the semester.  His lectures are extremely useful, just write down and listen to what he says and you will be golden. Textbook is not necessary with him, he even posts notes at the end of the week with everything you need to know.  Assignments were fun and exams weren't hard if you just pay attention to lecture.
He is one of the most smartest professor in sfu. if you attend his class every day, you will get your satisfied grade

Dixon's voice is a bit monotone but his clarity and concept explanations are top notch. Textbook is not needed at all, just make sure to attend every lecture and copy down everything he writes. Assignments and tests are not easy but they are fair so study hard and put in a good amount of effort. Definitely recommend taking his courses.

Barely opened the textbook & never missed a lecture, because his lectures & online class notes are clear, organized, and all you need to know. Assignments were long, but fun & informative. Very helpful, considerate, & thorough when asked questions in person or via email. Warning: he makes typos, so if you think you're right, speak up.
Gives thorough lectures, and gave weekly lecture summaries online. I thought the tests, and assignments were fair.
Makes us do too much in one class! Pre-requisites not enough.
The course is hard, but he is the most helpful prof i've ever had! Extremely nice :) Go to his office and you will never get into trouble with assignment or exam!

This is a challenging course, but Dixon's extremely helpful office hours and his crystal clear notes make this a walk in the park. He works through examples in lecture similar to what's been assigned. Definitely recommended.

Definitely one of the best professors I have ever had. His voice may seem a bit monotone, but if you're interested in the material, you'll stay awake. EVERY single day he has covered every detail of his lecture with perfect clarity. He even gives examples that run parallel to the assignments, so you should never hit a "road block" in this course.

Labs were easy, assignments were hard. You WILL need to study for MT and final, because they are extremely hard. However, he's an extremely good prof w/ good notes. Highly recommended for cmpt150/250 because you'll learn alot.

If it wasn't for the excellent TA, I might have failed the course. For Dixon's class, you need to interact with either the TA or the prof. Dixon is very helpful only if you talk to him. Warning: very hard tests, assignments, AND labs

This guy has THE best notes ever. He explains everything, and answers every single question. Assignments and tests were LONG and HARD, but still do-able. He'll answer all your questions if you ask him. One thing thou: his voice is too soft and monotone, so it can get a bit boring.
his only problem is that his voice is too soft that makes ppl to go to sleep. but other than that, he's one of the nicest prof in sfu.

prepares good lectures. sometimes you cannot concentrate on lecture materials just because he sometimes goes too fast. super nice prof. TAs mark the exams easy. able to see final exam after grades are posted (just email him). prepares good notes

The course is difficult for those without prior experience, as the learning curve is logarithmic. Don't fall behind or else it's game over. Software isn't free, so it's hard to work at home. Don't take with other hard courses.
Does not inform you if the midterm is coming up. Doesnt even say anything about it(format etc.).
The old man doesn't know how to teach.
Excellent prof, but exams are hard; assignments are doable but require a good deal of time and effort.

At the first glance, he's a very organized prof. The notes more clear than other CMPT classes. However, do NOT be fooled this class is easy! The notes do NOT adequetely prepare you for the asns and exams, and they look MUCH harder(although they should NOT). You need to SELF STUDY a lot, and it'll cost you BIG TIME if you are too busy w/ MACM!
Wonderful prof whose notes are very easy to understand... Very helpful!
Monotone voice which is boring. Extremely good with his material, takes it very seriously, classy guy, little sense of humor.

Notes are well organized. Lectures are clear, although it seems boring.(Notes are posted online later) There's a lot to learn in the class, but parts of the assignments are disappointly HARD! Mixed feelings - The prof is great, but again the marks, ...

Good prof.His notes are the BEST. In his office hours,you can ask many question you want, and it doesn't matter how many times you don't understand the concept, he will repeat it until you got it :)Assignments are pretty helpful and difficulty is "so so". Midterms & Finals are easy if you study.I prefer this prof to everyone who needs to take CMPT.
Assignments are hard! but Exams are very easy. strange huh?!

One of the best Prof I have ever met in the computing scicenc. Strong recommend to take his cmpt150. Organization is very good, teaching is very good. He is very patient and always try to help students.
One of the best professor around, extremely helpful.  Make sure u take him if he's teaching this course
Such a fun and interesting class!  One of the best CMPT teachers I've had at SFU.  Final was tricky, but he really cares about his students.  Will go the extra mile to help you.

Read others' compliments about his teaching. I just want to mention that usually we rarely see Santa Claus type of people with his hotness. He is so energetic - we couldn't catch up with him when rushing into the classroom one day. Hot and cute type! Try!
Very helpful and kind man.  Always willing to stay those extra 15minutes to make sure you understand something... plus he's like a santa clause/ sean connery hybrid.

He is one of the best cmpt prof in SFU compares to other prof that is teaching cmpt 150.  He cares about students and willing to asnwer any questions you have.  Even though you think the questions are dumb.

He's one of the best teachers. Assignments and midterms are hard. Final is not easy. =) But he's very helpful during his office hours and willing to answer as many questions as you have. He always gives students extra hours after the regular office hours.

First of all, Cmpt 150 has never been easy and never will be. Dixon is doing a good job compared to others and is fair too. Yet, don't forget to check if there are good TA's as they have a very important role in this course.
brilliant lecturer. but made first year 150 harder than some of my second/third year courses.
"hmm...dont care, and we put a x, dont care"; "we can just down to our local supplier like radio shack."
Leaves us behind in the dust.  Looks like Sean Connery.

He knows what he is doing.  He has a good knowledge in computing science.  But he not a good teacher.  He does not try to clarify stuff.  He just assume you understand and keeps on going to new materials.  Tough assinments.
He was ridiculously difficult and did not spend enough effort to clarify material to the students
EXCELLENT professor. He is very helpful with his rich knowledge. He is the prof. that you do not see everyday.
hard, very hard
If you can stay awake, he is a great prof. Assignments [for CMPT 150] are nasty but necessary.
Nice prof.
very good teaching, good notes, challenging tests
good teacher but exams are very hard!
very nice prof, care about students' understanding, kill ya on exams
Nice prof, challenging assignments, hard tests
his teaching style is difficult.. he goes over examples very quick..
He knows the material well and taought well, but test are hard.
Great lecturer. Easy midterms and moderate final.
Very nice guy, gives hard miterms and exams though.
No Comments
Incredibly concise and a brilliant lecturer. Really knows his stuff
Very very tough, but a good teacher. Just beware of those damn exams
No Comments
Very, very boring, Hard Exams.
If you pick things up quickly, stay away. He goes VERY slowly.
Great Teacher, very responsible teacher.
haha... UNIX, that must be it, but he is a great teacher.
No Comments
Really knows his stuff
android-like, i think he's running on unix. wonderful prof.

Diana is a super nice prof. She cares about students and she can explain the concepts really well. Office hours is helpful, assignments and exams are fair. She even gave me extension on an assignment because I was going through some tough family issues. I took 2 courses with her and wish I could take more!

Diana is one of the best profs to take 150 with, she is great at explaining concepts and her notes are stellar! Very easy to follow. She engages you in class (doesnt pick on people, she asks questions to engage) & her assignments/exams were helpful and fair overall (you still need to study). Very dedicated & helpful professor - highly recommend.

An exceptionally helpful professor. Even for an introductory class, she makes it a total breeze and allows cheat sheet for the midterms/finals. Exams are fair, if you studied you will be fine. No questions out of the ordinary. Assignments tedious but very helpful and good practice. Shes super helpful even during exams! Ask her questions! Great prof
She was a great prof to have, very helpful and clear notes. Exams were fair. Assignments were a bit long but she explains material well enough for you to do a decent job.
The model professor. Clear, concise, and super nice! I  failed first midterm, but after talking to Diana and listening to her lectures everything became crystal clear. I ended up getting B+.

She really cares about what she's teaching, and she's clear about it.  The course is very easy, most-of-which is because she does a solid lecture.
 There are times when the course drags, though.
She's a very nice prof.  Her notes are decent, and the assignments/exams were straightforward (no surprises).

She's a nice prof... but i personally dont understand a thing she teaches... maybe it's her teaching style... or maybe it's mine learning style... when she was tryin to teach conversion of binary... i was very confused... even tho it's SUPPOSE to be very simple... (i know it's simple since i learned it in High Scool) when she taught it. not simple
10 years later and I still tell people to avoid him.

Lectures are boring and unclear, hard to follow and keep up with the prof. Have to do a ton of reading in your spare time if you want to pass your exams. Assignments and exams feels like a huge jump from what he talks about in class. Avoid taking 150 with this prof unless you have a low class load. MT was hard, final was insane.

Yeah this class was hard; assignments were long, material wasn't too easy to learn, but Brad was great. He's not the nicest person to talk to but you come out of this class being a way better programmer. Props to him. Hope he continues to teach 150.

Worst prof I've ever had. Boring lectures. Hard exams. Always available during office hours, but you gain little to nothing after talking with him. Assignments are insanely hard and requires a lot of work/time. Took this the same semester I took macm + 2 electives and although I passed both courses, I've never studied so hard for an average grade.
do not take the class unless you are interested in Programming. super Hard Prof. picky about very minor details. dont wanna see him ever again in my life. crazy.
Goes through material super fast, you miss one class and your done, marks super hard. Don't take the class with him.

CMPT 150 isn't necessarily hard, but there is a LOT of content. Brad went through this material extremely fast, and ended the semester a week early, saying, "I don't do review sessions". He doesn't help review or do anything at all, and he's not very available for office hours. Not very good at explaining either. Don't take his class.

This guy give u a very clear scope on all the prospects in computer science. his test and assign are hard(2nd midterm and final). u must be well prepared and study all his notes for the tests. if u do so, u are getting a good grade
Brad is an excellent teacher and I really enjoyed his class.

Most people will give this prof a bad rating because it's hard to get high grades on assignments, and because he won't just tell you how to do something, he'll force you to figure it out after giving you some clues.  I've had him for CMPT 120 as well and for both courses he gave very hard assignments, but the tests ended up being easy in comparison
Very hard assignments and unfair marking on tests.
never ever want to see him again
very good at clearly explaining difficult concepts
All I can say.. I hate this guy the most. He should spend all his time playing games and automate them. don't teach..
Great prof. Students often equate "hard course" with "bad prof", but if you actually care about learning anything, Brad's a good prof.

CMPT15/300  Very good prof - not easy, and expects you to think for yourself on assignments rather than just parrot stuff, but teaches you lots and quite funny in class (dry sense of humor).  Encourages questions and will explain things again.  Very competent, and I'd recommend him highly, but be prepared to work for you grade!

Apparently, going to all the lectures, reading the readings,and doing the assignments are not enough for the final and midterms. Suffice to say, do not take it with him. He is helpful though but still a hard course for a first year course.
difficult

I went to all his lectures, however, I still failed the course. His assignments are really hard and time-consuming. The lab questions are hard as well. Basically, you will get new assignment and new lab questions every week. by the way, he writes down his notes every class so if you miss the class you'll have to copy the notes from someone else. Hi
No online notes posts, so if you missed one (or even half) of the class, it will be diffcult to catch up.

I've taken two courses with him. I find him to be an spectacular prof in terms of teaching and level of interest. He really know what he's talking about and his lectures and notes are one of the best I've seen from any prof. If you miss lectures you're screwed. His exams are not easy but if you attend all lectures and read the text, you'll do well.
Sure he makes you learn but hes an **** in the process
Kind of a jerk. Didn't enjoy his class. Rude.

really clear, organized wonderful teacher, throughly understood everything he said, but test and assignments were very hard and time consuming. have to work hard, but in the end you understand EVERYTHING

He's organized and lectures well but skips through critical parts and makes the course material much harder than it is. Basically leaves you having to figure it out on your own and teach yourself.
 
 I took CMPT250 with Dixon afterwards (has much more complex and challenging material) and it felt WAY easier than than CMPT150 with Bart.
dudes pathetic. wont reply to emails regarding the contents of upcoming emails. surviving in this class by looking through other proffs course sites.
A nice prof. Explains things very well and has a crystal clear voice. Has some good sense of humor as well. Watch out, assignments are a bit long and not worth very much. Exams were overall fair.
knowledgable, professional, helpful, The best instructor I ve ever met.
Teaches more than the bare bones, and make assignments so that you can explore a bit.
Good prof, Easy midterms, fair final. Good notes.

I had Brad as a prof during his first semester teaching CMPT 150. It was hard and thorough. I didn't even bother going to Dixon's 250 lectures, I'd heard it all already. Brad is a great help, and very well equiped to teach, but suffers from fanboys.

B Bart, funny guy, but this course is very very hard to follow. EXTREMELY HARD Final! very difficult assignments. Midterms are ok. Notes are very good, just that the materials are hard. He is an ok prof

I agree with the complaints here; however, he *is* a good lecturer.  As long as you go to class and do the assignments, you should do fine.  He gets upset whenever someone asks about the marking scheme though.

I studied cmpt150 taught by Mr. Bart. I admit he is a smart guy but his assignments are lengthy and hard. He is a humurous person but his lectures are extrmemely hard to follow. He is tough, eg., If the max. mark is 71, then the highest grade is B-.
A course KILLER!!!! VERY BAD ATTITUDE!!!
Bad attitude towards student
messed up proff
You will learn a heck of a lot. Has a magic marking scheme (midterm marks vanish
Tough course, but you learn a lot, and that's what you're there for
Too much work.exams r relatively easy.u r guaranteed to understand the material.
CRAZY(!!!) workload, but good teaching
don't buy the book.  just read the notes
clear, precise, great lecturer-better than most profs! makes you analyze
He's cool
Nice instructor, assignments and exams are hard, but you really can learn a lot
Didn't like his style of teaching at all!!
He is extremely hard on all the assignments/exam.
He's a pretty nice teacher, but the assignments/exams are difficult
Good at lectures, funny... exams are hard though... and girls like him....
Doesn't feel like classtime, more like storytime, keep up the good work.
awesome teacher, but harder assignments/exams than other teachers of same course
good teacher but hard
Awesome prof
very good prof!! best one i've met in cmpt and he knows his stuff very well. class notes are useful so do attend class.
oh.he is very a lousy teacher.first,his accent is very srtong.second,he is not a respond teacher.third,when we need help,he can't give us the help that can make us understad.in sum,horrible!@

Really lazy and unorganized, unfair in marking, hard to understand, not enough domination on topics, makes lot of mistakes but if you do the same you'll lose your mark. When you made an appointment with him, you should not expect to see him on time. On the other hand he usually tries to be nice and show that he's confident...
Becaue of him !!! I messed up this course. Because of him!!! my GPA has got lowed. Because of him!! I've learnt not much useful things. He may be a nice person but not ready to be a good teacher yet.

Textbook is hard to follow.  Marking was unfair.  Lazy teacher and not really clear with what he is trying to teach.  He posts the lecture notes for the first few weeks on the course website then suddenly stopped doing so.   I would not want to take another class with this instructor.

He is irresponsible, mean, lazy, rude, helpless, and unclear of his teaching. He gave us a wrong email address so that no one could ask him questions. The assignments were usually due in few days after being posted. It took him ages to mark assts & MT's. The marking was unfair. TA was not able to explain any question we asked and had no office hour

Avoid this prof.  He is really unclear so you'll spend a lot of time studying yourself.  Notes are very disorganized and he always tells you to look at the textbook.  The textbook used in the course sucks too, it is really hard to follow and more complicated than it needs to be.  Probably the hardest to follow text book that I've used before.

He is so not organize..He doesn't explain much..Gave us a taking home assignment(part of mid-term) the same day he taught the materials and needed to finish in less than 2 days of time.The TA is useless.Did only 1-2 Qs during a 50mins lab.Everything sucks in his class.
Worst prof I've ever had in my academic career so far.
bad...bad...bad...
he is not clear on what he teaches. He doesnt explain things very well either, most of the class is confused by his way of teaching
